Content.Name: Qualifications
Content.Title: Qualifications
Content.Abstract: All applicants of the RN to BSN program must meet the following qualifications: Have a current, unencumbered license to practice as a Registered Nurse within the USA Be admitted to BYU-Idaho
Content.BodyCopy:
All applicants of the RN to BSN Program must meet the following qualifications:

  • Have a current, unencumbered license to practice as a Registered Nurse within the USA
  • Be admitted to BYU-Idaho
  • If you desire the 3-semester course sequence, you must have the prerequisite for NURS 338 completed which is: FDMAT 108 Math for the Real World or FDMAT 221, 222 or 223

Applicants will be evaluated on:

  • Completeness of Nursing Application
  • Work experience in nursing
  • Meeting University Foundation / General Education (GE) requirements
  • GPA

Transfer Students

Please be aware of the Academic Policies stated in the BYU-Idaho Catalog, which determine the transferability of degrees and/or credits from other institutions. The transferability of degrees and/or credits directly affects the BYU-Idaho graduation requirements you are expected to fulfill. Some of those policies are as follows:

  • Associate Degrees from regionally-accredited institutions generally meet the majority of the Foundations/G.E. requirements for a Bachelor's Degree at BYU-Idaho.
  • Applied Associate Degrees do not meet the Foundations / G.E. requirements for a Bachelor's Degree at BYU-Idaho.
  • Courses (including nursing courses) from institutions that are not regionally accredited are generally not transferable to BYU-Idaho.

Transfer students are responsible for meeting all graduation requirements including University requirements. Contact the College of Agriculture and Life Science Academic Discovery Center at (208) 496-9830 if you have questions.
